identificationModule.briefTitle: Wearable Devices for Secondary Prevention of Ischemic Stroke
identificationModule.officialTitle: Wearable Devices for Secondary Prevention of Ischemic Stroke

descriptionModule.briefSummary: Ischemic stroke is an important cause of death and disability in Western countries. Different risk factors have been identified such as hypertension, diabetes, dyslipidemia, smoke, atrial fibrillation, obesity, and sedentary. The aim of this study is to evaluate the feasibility of an approach based on the use of wearable devices for the identification and reduction of risk factors in patients with previous history of ischemic stroke or transient ischemic attack.

armGroups.label: Wearable Devices Monitoring
armGroups.description: Patients will be provided with wearable devices for at-home monitoring heart rhythm and rate, blood pressure, pulse oximetry, quality and quantity of sleep, and pace counting.
interventionNames: Device: Wearable devices for identifying and measuring risk factors for ischemic stroke

armGroups.label: Standard of Care Monitoring
armGroups.description: Patients will be evaluated by periodical clinical visits.

interventions.name: Wearable devices for identifying and measuring risk factors for ischemic stroke
interventions.description: Identifying and monitoring cerebrovascular risk factors using wearable devices

primaryOutcomes.measure: Compliance of patients to at-home follow-up by means of wearable devices
primaryOutcomes.description: Number of measurements actually performed in comparison to number of expected measurements

secondaryOutcomes.description: Percentage of subjects with atrial fibrillation detected within 1 month of follow-up

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Prevalence of Recurrent Stroke or Transient Ischemic Attack
secondaryOutcomes.description: Prevalence of subjects with recurrent stroke or Transient Ischemic Attack within 1 month of follow-up

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Age greater than or equal 50 years
* Recent transient ischemic attack or minor stroke

Exclusion Criteria:

* Patients with significant cognitive impairment
* Patients dependent in the instrumental activities of daily life
* Patients not able to respect the frequency of monitoring program
* Patients with history of atrial fibrillation
